item.title: [UPCOMING] Supercomputing for social scientists with R
item.description: In February 2024, we will host a workshop regarding Cluster Computing for Social Scientists with R.

item.title: Training a fastText model from scratch using Python
item.description: By now, it’s no surprise to anybody the astonishing results large language models produce.

item.title: Data Visualization Bootcamp
item.description: In October 2023, we hosted a workshop about data visualization.

item.title: Visualizing international flows with Geoflow visualizer
item.description: In this tutorial we present Geoflow, a newly created tool designed to visualize international flows in an interactive way.

item.title: Wrangling interval data using lubridate
item.description: One common issue we encounter in helping researchers work with the housing register data of Statistics Netherlands is its transactional nature: each row in the housing register table contains data on when someone registered and deregistered at an address (more info in Dutch here).

item.title: Collecting online platforms data for science: an example using WhatsApp
item.description: These days, our online presence leaves traces of our behavior everywhere.

item.title: Network science
item.description: In June 2023, we hosted a workshop about Network Science.

item.title: Causal Impact Assesment
item.description: In May 2023, we hosted a workshop in Causal Impact Assesment focusing on policy interventions.

item.title: ArtScraper: A Python library to scrape online artworks
item.description: ArtScraper is a Python library to download images and metadata for artworks available on WikiArt and Google Arts & Culture.

item.title: How to share your research code
item.description: With the increasing popularity of open science practices, it is now more and more common to openly share code along with more traditional scientific objects such as papers.

item.title: Efficient programming with CBS microdata
item.description: In May 2022, we hosted a workshop about efficient programming for accessing CBS microdata.

item.title: How to create synthetic data
item.description: In September 2022, we hosted a workshop about synthetic data.

item.title: Fellowship
item.description: During your time as a fellow: you will spend between 3-8 months full-time* working on a social science research project.
